result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Tabbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence with Huber for work and vocational training.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Tabbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence with Huber for work and vocational training.

Court ordered defendant complete an AODA assessment and provide a DNA sample.

 Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 24 MONTHS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Defendant's operating privilege for operation of Class D vehicles is restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device; and each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration must be equipped with an ignition interlock device beginning on the date the department issues any license and for a period of 18 MONTHS  thereafter.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by 07/22/2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $600.00; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
- Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
AODA Assesment 

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Ronald Tabbert in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Ronald Tabbert in court with attorney Chris Hartley for Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Robert E Tabbert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, recevied and filed.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program, FILED.

Defendant Ronald Tabbert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, and with the agreement of all parties, Pretrial Conference adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Ronald ~ Tabbert in court with attorney Christopher L Hartley.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-09-2014 at 08:30 am.
From Attorney Michael Hayes, dated 04-18-2012, confirming Attorney Mark Pecora as attorney of record in this matter.

Defendant Ronald Edwin Tabbert in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.
letter from Hayes & Rothstein, S.C Attorneys at Law

14RM020558  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-11-14

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM, drug tests and portable breathalyzers.   No alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Edwin Tabbert in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Ronald Edwin Tabbert in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
